intro: Mentha sylvestris var. virescens, commonly known as green wood mint, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its aromatic leaves contain essential oils, making it a valuable plant in both traditional medicine and culinary uses.
